text:
Hi,
I have README.shtml files containing exactly one line:
<!--#include virtual="multiviewed" -->

Since MultiViews is on, this finds multiviewed.txt.
In the URL specified you can find the actual files.

The output places multiviewed.txt contents before file listing.
This will not happen if:
- README.shtml specified the full extension, or
- README.shtml had some other text before that line, or
- multiviewed.txt had no read permission (in this case
its content won't be displayed, but the error line comes
in the correct position.)

I'll be most grateful if you can shred some insight on that...
Thanks
Ale
creator: vesely@tana.it

text: User questions should be sent to users@httpd.apache.org
creator: davi@apache.org

text:
Uh, I forgot about this bug from 2003...

That version had some flaws with include/multiviews, and produced
inconsistent behavior although apparently following some logic.
I hadn't been able to spot exactly _what_ was wrong since I did
not know precisely what it was supposed to do, except that README
should go on the bottom.

Anyway, various versions passed by, and I visited the demo in
http://www.tana.it/readme/ and the README appears correctly at the
bottom using a newer 2.0 server. Thus I mark it as closed.
creator: vesely@tana.it
